result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey J Czerniak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with Ryan McKeown.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

Disposition Form
Appeals rights form given to counsel; to return upon obtaining def's signature.

Def appears in custody via video & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich in person.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: CP.  Victim appears via phone.  Re-sentencing hearing.  Court recites history of case and def's eligibility for Earned Release Program.  Court withdraws previous sentence and proceeds w/joint recommendation.  State recites recommendation. records.addlTxt: Letter received from Atty Katherine Romanowich
Victim requests to be present for sentencing hearing
Disposition Form

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Victim: Ryan P. M. also present, in custody; State moves to amend Ct. 2 to Misd. Battery contrary to 940.19(1); Joint recommendation.  Statements from victim.  Court grants motion to amend Ct. 2; On a plea to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 as amended, State moves to dismiss and read in case 15CM203;  No contest plea entered on Ct. 1 & Ct. 2 as amended.  Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty on Ct 1 & Ct 2 as amended, on motion of the state, court dismisses case 15CM203 for read in.  Statements from State, defense;  Court proceeds to sentencing. Discussion regarding prison programming (ERP/CIP).  Defense to provide court with documentation stating that defendants eligibility for ERP/CIP will be negatively affected by a jail consecutive to prison sentence; if defendent is not eligible for programming due to the sentence imposed, court will resentence defendant.
Sentencing hearing at 06-25-2015 01:30 pm

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Peter John Cannon & Atty Samuel Tufford for State.  Case resolved; Victim requests to be present for sentencing, state requests adjournment to allow time to make arrangments for victim to appear (located in jail). Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Plea/Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing at 06-24-2015 08:15 am

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def has pending sentence after revocation in Br 3 (12CF461).  Counsel req adj.    Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant refused to sign
Hearing at 05-12-2015 01:15 pm

Defendant appears in custody & w/Atty. Katherine Romanowich from the State Public Defenders Office.  Atty. Peter Cannon for State.  Branch 4 case.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  DNA previously taken; Court advises Defendant of expungement rights.  $2,500 signature bond set.  SPD will represent Defendant.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 1:15 p.m.  Per security, Defendant refuses to sign bond.
